http://www.nasa.gov/feature/apollo-astronaut-edgar-mitchell-dies-at-age-85

Quite sad. How do you guys feel about this?    He passed away on the 45th anniversary of his lunar landing.

Edited February 6, 2016 by batman78781

Another one of the selected few who actual could say I  went to the moon and walked on it another man who will reside in the history books as a legend

Rest in peace your STAR Stuff Now 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z_Q03O-F4fE

Yup, only seven people who landed on the moon are still alive IIRC. It's pretty sad that nobody will be able to say "I walked on the moon" for at least 10-15 more years, and even that is being overly optimistic.
